intro: Hieracium digeneum, commonly known as the two-lobed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium digeneum is an annual or biennial plant that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
